parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To cleanse, purify, either ceremonially, actually, or morally. From hagnos; to make clean, i.e. sanctify.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Obedience, submissiveness, compliance. From hupakouo; attentive hearkening, i.e. compliance or submission.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

word: you have a genuine love for your brothers,
str2: Brotherly love, love of Christian brethren. From philadelphos; fraternal affection.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.
Earnestly, strenuously, fervently. Adverb from ektenes; intently.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
